image.altText: A doctor wearing a white coat and a stethoscope writes on a clipboard.

props.synopsis: A Perth doctor is suspended after disclosing confidential medical information about a patient and her baby to her estranged husband, despite knowing there was a domestic violence restraining order against him.

title.children: Woman's medical records given to ex-partner despite domestic violence order

image.altText: A large body of water at a wastewater treatment plant in a desert area.

props.synopsis: Kalgoorlie-Boulder residents launch a petition to have the city's wastewater treatment plant relocated as they continue to grapple with a smell so bad that some fear it will drive people away.

title.children: Calls for more action to evict 'Mr Stinky' from outback city

image.altText: A silhouetted corrections officer walks down a corridor in a prison.

props.synopsis: An independent report has revealed psychological injury claims made by WA prison officers have more than doubled since 2019, and now account for a quarter of all claims.

title.children: Psychological injury compensation claims for WA prison staff double

image.altText: Steve Smith and Ben Stokes stand on the Perth Stadium outfield in their whites and blazers while holding the Ashes trophy

props.synopsis: The build-up to this Ashes series has been long and often painful, but will quickly be forgotten when the first bowl is bowled at Perth Stadium and all hell breaks loose today.

title.children: The build-up to the Perth Ashes Test has been predictable. The cricket will be anything but

image.altText: A small dachshund running over grass.

props.synopsis: A 44-year-old woman is fined almost $2,000 after she tried to insert a bag of methylamphetamine into her dog's body.

title.children: Woman fined after attempting to hide bag of meth in her sausage dog

image.altText: Archie Ludowyke pictured representing the national academy

props.synopsis: Archie Ludowyke goes to his bedroom thinking he is not going to get his AFL dream realised, only to to hear an eruption from his living room as his name is called out by the Adelaide Crows.

title.children: Heartbroken draftee misses moment as Eagles miss out on father-son prospect

image.altText: Track map 7.33am 21-11 jpg

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has declared a cyclone warning for Darwin as Cyclone Fina intensifies while tracking towards the Northern Territory capital.

title.children: BOM declares cyclone warning for Darwin as Fina tracks south-west

image.altText: WA Premier Roger Cook sits inside a race car while smiling.

props.synopsis: The path is cleared for a controversial racetrack to be built in Perth after Western Australia's environmental watchdog decides against launching a formal project assessment.

title.children: Controversial $217m racetrack progresses as environmental impact deemed 'not significant'

image.altText: Bald man in rash suit holding surfboard walks up beach steps

props.synopsis: Seven decades ago when Kevin Merifield started exploring breaks in WA's South West, locals thought he was crazy braving the "shark-infested" waters to surf.

title.children: Surfing pioneer hangs up board at age 87 after decades catching waves

image.altText: A drone photo of a shark circling a boat.

props.synopsis: Vision of sharks off the Esperance coastline ahead of its busy tourist season has some locals concerned and conflicted about solutions.

title.children: Shark activity raises concerns from locals ahead of summer

image.altText: A Smartrider reader at a train station.

props.synopsis: After delays and budget blowouts, Perth commuters will be able to use credit cards, phones and smart watches to swipe onto public transport and pay for their fares from December 8.

title.children: Phones, bank cards will tag people onto Perth public transport within weeks

image.altText: A completely unidentifiable man wearing a hat and face mask walks along a street.

props.synopsis: A Chinese national admits dangerous driving over a "horrific" crash at a car club meet-up that left 17-year-old Caitlyn Dickson with life-threatening injuries.

title.children: Driver pleads guilty over 'horrific' crash after club event that injured teen

image.altText: A medium of a building with a sign reading: "Albany justice complex"

props.synopsis: A German farm worker has been sentenced after pleading guilty to a second sexual assault in regional Western Australia.

title.children: Foreign farm worker sentenced over second sexual assault

image.altText: Jake and Callum Robinson stand next to each other and smile.

props.synopsis: A woman is sentenced to 20 years in jail for her role in a robbery in which three men, including two West Australian brothers, were killed in Mexico last year.

title.children: Mexican woman sentenced to 20-year jail term for role in brothers' killings

image.altText: Gif showing illustration of a house with household items and a fighter jet flying above.

props.synopsis: Take a tour around the house and see how everyday life is powered by critical minerals and why we will keep hearing so much about them.

title.children: How critical minerals power our daily lives from the moment we wake up

image.altText: A Virgin plane is seen through an airport terminal glass

props.synopsis: Virgin Australia and Qantas will ban the use of portable power banks from next month following a string of international incidents.

title.children: Virgin and Qantas to ban portable power banks after string of fires

image.altText: A worker installs electricity transmission components on an electricity pylon in Chuzhou.

props.synopsis: Countries across the globe are racing to rewire their electricity systems for a decarbonised future. In Australia, delays are mounting, along with doubts about whether it can meet goals on schedule.

title.children: Australia may just be one step ahead in the global race to rewire the world

image.altText: Climate Change Minister Chris Bowen

props.synopsis: The opposition leader has accused Chris Bowen of being a "part-time energy minister" after he stuck a deal to take up a negotiator role for COP31. Follow live.

title.children: Coalition accuses Chris Bowen of being a 'part-time energy minister'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Twitch added to social media ban
Sussan Ley says Bowen is a 'globetrotting' and 'part-time energy minister'
Hawke says Liberal party has 'brand issues' after resignation of NSW Liberal leader

image.altText: A unidentifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: A Perth childcare centre is fined after a child escaped last year, likely by using his "above-average" climbing skills to scale a fence.

title.children: Single educator left watching 17 kids on day boy escaped childcare centre

image.altText: A white woman in a black linen vest and pants, walking out of a building, brown hair tied back.

props.synopsis: Building company director Jessica Buckley is the fourth person charged with fraud over an alleged $71 million Department of Defence contracts scandal.

title.children: Fourth person charged over alleged $71m Defence contracts fraud

image.altText: A space station in orbit over a cloudy day on Earth.

props.synopsis: Moss has the potential to provide food for astronauts of the future, according to a study that exposed one of Earth's oldest plants to the extremes of space travel.

title.children: Super-tough moss survives nine months in space strapped to the ISS

image.altText: A sign that reads "keep left unless overtaking" stands in front of a downhill stretch of country highway.

props.synopsis: A decision to place an overtaking lane on a "steep downhill" section of the North West Coastal Highway in WA's Midwest has been condemned as "absolute stupidity".

title.children: Frustrated truckie labels $20m road upgrade a 'national disgrace'

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks at Chris Bowen while they sit in parliament.

props.synopsis: Türkiye is the big winner in the diplomatic stand-off over COP31, but nabbing the most powerful seat at the table while someone else picks up the lunch tab is not a bad result.

title.children: Türkiye may have won the big prize, but Australia got a Goldilocks solution

image.altText: bass guitarist gary mounfield screams while on stage in a purple shirt

props.synopsis: Mounfield was a member of the classic Stone Roses line-up for their 1989 self-titled debut album, which featured hits such as I Wanna Be Adored, She Bangs The Drums, and I Am The Resurrection.

title.children: Former Stone Roses bassist Gary 'Mani' Mounfield dies aged 63

image.altText: A Cybertruck sits on display, parked in the middle of a Tesla showroom floor

props.synopsis: Elon Musk hinted at his dream for a battery-electric pick-up truck for years before, finally, on November 21, 2019, Tesla unveiled a prototype for its Cybertruck.

title.children: Billionaire's sci-fi dream became 'world's most hated car'

image.altText: A mother giving her daughter pills out of a square bottle.

props.synopsis: As ADHD diagnoses rise, Australia's peak body for psychiatrists is calling for a national system to monitor and stop potential over-diagnosis of the condition.

title.children: Push for national approach to ADHD diagnoses as states forge different paths

image.altText: A woman's left hand strikes lettered keys on a computer keyboard with fingers that have painted fingernails.

props.synopsis: Australia's mining and manufacturing sectors are taking up to two years to notice and report cyber breaches to authorities, prompting concerns about the data security of industries critical to the nation's economy.

title.children: Data of up to 3.6m people exposed in cyber breaches, FOI shows

image.altText: A table with WA Police branding displays a selection of luxury clothes and accessories in front of a black luxury car.

props.synopsis: Police charge a 31-year-old man they allege is at the helm of an organised crime syndicate distributing black market tobacco in Perth.

title.children: Police arrest man believed to be behind Perth’s black market tobacco syndicate

image.altText: iron ore loading equipment over water

props.synopsis: A $300 million multi-user supply base is set to be built on Cockatoo Island, off the northern West Australian coast.

title.children: Aviation and marine hub off WA's Kimberley coast gets green light

image.altText: Globular red shapes float out of a sickly looking coral colony, with small fish swimming above.

props.synopsis: Scientists say they are "speechless" after witnessing significant coral death at the World Heritage-listed Ningaloo Reef.

title.children: Survey finds 60 per cent of Ningaloo coral has turned to stone

image.altText: Adam McGovern wears a hat, face mask and dark jacket as he walks outside the District Court.

props.synopsis: Adam Simon McGovern, 50, goes on trial in Perth, accused of dozens of charges of indecent recording women and girls on public transport and in supermarkets.

title.children: Man on trial accused of making indecent recordings of women, girls

image.altText: A sandstone building with a sign reading 'Department of Communities Housing'.

props.synopsis: A mother who was facing eviction from her social housing home after complaints from neighbours will be allowed to stay, after a court finds the incidents mostly stemmed from her domestic violence abuse.

title.children: Housing Dept tried to evict DV victim after noise complaints related to abuse

image.altText: A boat on land.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese is refusing to be drawn on how much a program to remove people from Australia's northern waters using repurposed fishing boats is costing, saying it is a legacy project.

title.children: PM says no apologies over Border Force's secret boat returnee scheme
